article.title: Cubic to Develop Counter-CBRN Technologies
article.text: Cubic Applications Inc., San Diego, has been awarded a $9,900,000 modification (P00001) to increase the contract ceiling to previously awarded contract FA8650-15-D-6580. Contractor will provide solutions to enhance the Air Force chemical, biological, radiological, and nuclear (CBRN) counter proliferation and survivability missions program. The contractor will research, test, evaluate and analyze short and long term CBRN technologies. Work will be performed at San Diego; Wright Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio; MacDill Air Force Base, Florida; and Camp Smith, Hawaii, and is expected to be complete by January 5, 2020. No funds are being obligated at the time of award. Air Force Research Laboratory, Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio, is the contracting activity.
